definition: variant of 夭[yao1]/to die young/to die prematurely/Taiwan pr. [yao3]
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased

sentences.english: But such a death will leave deep emotional scars with the parents.
sentences.chinese: 但这样的夭亡会给父母留下很深的情感创疤。

sentences.english: Today before you complain about life - Think of someone who went too early to heaven.
sentences.chinese: 在抱怨人生不如意之前，想想还有人中年夭亡。

sentences.english: Sudden romantic connections may be short lived.
sentences.chinese: 突然的浪漫关系可能是短寿命会夭亡。

sentences.english: Most of the bacteria were detected in the babies' lungs and spleens .
sentences.chinese: 在夭亡婴儿的肺和脾内可以检测出大量的上述细菌。

sentences.english: Remember that in general the smaller the tortoise the more likely it is to end up as a hibernation casualty.
sentences.chinese: 不要忘了，通常越小的龟龟越容易在冬眠中夭亡。

definition: sudden attack of a serious illness
to leave one's mortal frame (idiom)/to die
to die an untimely death (idiom)/to be cut off in one's prime
to fall ill and die/to die of illness
